alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 5:33PM MST until July 03 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 533 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Southwest Cochise county. An automated rain gage at Hunter Canyon in the Huachuca Mountains recorded 1.85 inches of rain had fallen in the past hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially impacting Hunter Canyon Road and Highway 92. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sierra Vista, Hereford and Coronado National Memorial. This includes the following streams and drainages... San Pedro River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
